channel.title: Music Planet: Road Trip
channel.description: Discover the world with music. Join local experts for a sonic journey around the globe.
channel.itunes:summary: Discover the world with music. Join local experts for a sonic journey around the globe.
channel.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Lithuania
item.description: Indrė Jurgelevičiūtė takes us on a journey over the last century of Lithuanian music
item.itunes:subtitle: Indrė Jurgelevičiūtė takes us on a journey over the last century of Lithuanian music
item.itunes:summary: Indrė Jurgelevičiūtė takes us on a journey over the last century of Lithuanian music
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Argentina
item.description: Betto Arcos travels across northeast Argentina in search of Chamamé music; a genre of rural dance music absorbing Spanish, Guarani and African influences
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos travels across northeast Argentina in search of Chamamé music
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos travels across northeast Argentina in search of Chamamé music; a genre of rural dance music absorbing Spanish, Guarani and African influences
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: South Africa
item.description: Bill Odidi guides us through some of the greatest South African musicians, including Solomon Linda who wrote one of the most famous songs to come out of the region; 'Mbube'
item.itunes:subtitle: Bill Odidi guides us through the music of Miriam Makeba, Solomon Linda and BCUC
item.itunes:summary: Bill Odidi guides us through some of the greatest South African musicians, including Solomon Linda who wrote one of the most famous songs to come out of the region; 'Mbube'
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Cuba
item.description: In the second of two reports from Havana, Betto Arcos looks at the revival of Cuban son music; a direct result of the release of Buena Vista Social Club's first album in 1997
item.itunes:subtitle: In the second of two reports from Havana, Betto Arcos looks at the revival of son music
item.itunes:summary: In the second of two reports from Havana, Betto Arcos looks at the revival of Cuban son music; a direct result of the release of Buena Vista Social Club's first album in 1997
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: South Korea
item.description: Chris Ryu takes us on a Road Trip to South Korea where we discover the interesting ways in which performance genre 'Pansori' is evolving
item.itunes:subtitle: Chris Ryu explores the evolution of Pansori music
item.itunes:summary: Chris Ryu takes us on a Road Trip to South Korea where we discover the interesting ways in which performance genre 'Pansori' is evolving
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Kazakhstan
item.description: Zhadyra Zhumakulbay reports from the rich and varied musical heritage of Kazakhstan; a country landlocked between Russia and China
item.itunes:subtitle: Music of nightingales and horse herder flutes
item.itunes:summary: Zhadyra Zhumakulbay reports from the rich and varied musical heritage of Kazakhstan; a country landlocked between Russia and China
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Mozambique
item.description: Ivan Larenjeira takes us on a Road Trip through Mafala in Maputo Mozambique.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ivan Larenjeira takes us on a Road Trip through Mafala in Maputo Mozambique.
item.itunes:summary: Ivan Larenjeira takes us on a Road Trip through Mafala in Maputo Mozambique.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Portugal
item.description: Betto Arcos takes us to the Portuguese capital, Lisbon, where he explores the world of the Portuguese Guitar.
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos is in Lisbon, where he finds out about the Portuguese Guitar
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos takes us to the Portuguese capital, Lisbon, where he explores the world of the Portuguese Guitar.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Cuba
item.description: Betto Arcos reports from Havana in the first of two road trips from Cuba. This week explores the emergence of new dance music and the fusion of rumba with jazz and funk
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos is in Havana for the first of two road trip episodes from the island of Cuba
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos reports from Havana in the first of two road trips from Cuba. This week explores the emergence of new dance music and the fusion of rumba with jazz and funk
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Réunion
item.description: Jérôme Galabert, manager of Sakifo Records, reports from the small volcanic island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean; home to traditional Maloya and Sega music
item.itunes:subtitle: Maloya and Sega music feature in this week's Road Trip from Réunion Island
item.itunes:summary: Jérôme Galabert, manager of Sakifo Records, reports from the small volcanic island of Réunion in the Indian Ocean; home to traditional Maloya and Sega music
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: South India
item.description: Chirag Jain reports from India with music from the regions of Tamil Nadu and Kerala on the Arabian Sea. Also, music from the doyenne of Carnatic music, M. S. Subbulakshmi
item.itunes:subtitle: Chirag Jain reports from India with music from Tamil Nadu to Kerala on the Arabian Sea
item.itunes:summary: Chirag Jain reports from India with music from the regions of Tamil Nadu and Kerala on the Arabian Sea. Also, music from the doyenne of Carnatic music, M. S. Subbulakshmi
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Guizhou (China)
item.description: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian takes us on a Road Trip to Guizhou province of China
item.itunes:subtitle: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian takes us on a Road Trip to Guizhou province of China
item.itunes:summary: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian takes us on a Road Trip to Guizhou province of China
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Ecuador
item.description: Betto Arcos is in Quito exploring music rich in Andean traditions, including sounds of the traditional charango guitar, quena flute and music from the Quechua people
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos is in Quito exploring music that evokes the beauty of the Andean landscape
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos is in Quito exploring music rich in Andean traditions, including sounds of the traditional charango guitar, quena flute and music from the Quechua people
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Czech Republic
item.description: From the bagpipes of the south west to the village tunes of Moravia in the east. Broadcaster Petr Doruzka guides us through the melting pot of influences that make up the music of the Czech Republic.
item.itunes:subtitle: From the bagpipes of the south west to the village tunes of Moravia
item.itunes:summary: From the bagpipes of the south west to the village tunes of Moravia in the east. Broadcaster Petr Doruzka guides us through the melting pot of influences that make up the music of the Czech Republic.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Lebanon
item.description: Artistic Director of Beirut and Beyond festival, Amani Semaan, reports from Beirut with music from Lebanese artists such as Fairuz, Wadih El Safi and Marcel Khalife - some of the most influential musicians in the Arab world.
item.itunes:subtitle: Amani Semaan reports from Beirut on some of the most influential music of the Arab world
item.itunes:summary: Artistic Director of Beirut and Beyond festival, Amani Semaan, reports from Beirut with music from Lebanese artists such as Fairuz, Wadih El Safi and Marcel Khalife - some of the most influential musicians in the Arab world.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Tanzania
item.description: Bill Odidi reports on the varied musical traditions of Tanzania; from the Chaga communities on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, to the taarab music of Zanzibar
item.itunes:subtitle: Music of the wilderness; from the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro to the island of Zanzibar
item.itunes:summary: Bill Odidi reports on the varied musical traditions of Tanzania; from the Chaga communities on the slopes of Mount Kilimanjaro, to the taarab music of Zanzibar
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Algeria
item.description: A mountain welcome dance and processional wedding music of the Kabyle people; dancer Amel Tafsout introduces the amazingly varied and rich musical traditions of Algeria
item.itunes:subtitle: A mountain welcome dance and processional wedding music of the Kabyle people
item.itunes:summary: A mountain welcome dance and processional wedding music of the Kabyle people; dancer Amel Tafsout introduces the amazingly varied and rich musical traditions of Algeria
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: North India
item.description: Reporting from Bangalore, arts curator Chirag Jain presents some of the most beautiful music from northern India; from the flatlands of Gujarat through to hills of Bengal
item.itunes:subtitle: Music from the barren flatlands of Gujarat through to charming hills of Bengal
item.itunes:summary: Reporting from Bangalore, arts curator Chirag Jain presents some of the most beautiful music from northern India; from the flatlands of Gujarat through to hills of Bengal
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Philippines
item.description: José Buenconsejo introduces us to the music of the Philippines
item.itunes:subtitle: José Buenconsejo introduces us to the music of the Philippines
item.itunes:summary: José Buenconsejo introduces us to the music of the Philippines
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Panama
item.description: In this week's Road Trip Betto Arcos transports us to the Festival de la Mejorana in Panama, one of the oldest traditional music festivals in Latin America.
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos transports us to the Festival de la Mejorana in Panama
item.itunes:summary: In this week's Road Trip Betto Arcos transports us to the Festival de la Mejorana in Panama, one of the oldest traditional music festivals in Latin America.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Cartagena (Colombia)
item.description: Betto Arcos reports from Cartagena; one of the most musically diverse cities on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. This episode comes with addictive Latin beats.
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos is back reporting from the musically diverse port city of Cartagena, Colombia
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos reports from Cartagena; one of the most musically diverse cities on the Caribbean coast of Colombia. This episode comes with addictive Latin beats.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Latvia
item.description: Infectious bagpipe dances, multipart singing and the mesmerising sound of the Latvian zither or 'kokle'. Lauma Berza is our guide through the villages of Latvia.
item.itunes:subtitle: Infectious bagpipe dances, multipart singing and the mesmerising sound of the 'kokle'
item.itunes:summary: Infectious bagpipe dances, multipart singing and the mesmerising sound of the Latvian zither or 'kokle'. Lauma Berza is our guide through the villages of Latvia.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Slovakia
item.description: A giant shepherd's flute, multi-part singing, and field recordings from Béla Bartok; Vladimír Potančok takes us through Slovakia's UNESCO-preserved music
item.itunes:subtitle: A giant shepherd's flute, multi-part singing, and field recordings from Béla Bartók
item.itunes:summary: A giant shepherd's flute, multi-part singing, and field recordings from Béla Bartok; Vladimír Potančok takes us through Slovakia's UNESCO-preserved music
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Uganda
item.description: James Isabiyre reports from Uganda, and explores musical traditions from indigenous communities before the country's political upheaval in the late 1960's
item.itunes:subtitle: Traditional village music from Uganda before the 1960's political upheaval
item.itunes:summary: James Isabiyre reports from Uganda, and explores musical traditions from indigenous communities before the country's political upheaval in the late 1960's
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Kenya
item.description: Traditional benga music to Afro-fusion, plus legend Ayub Ogada plays the nyatiti (Kenyan harp); broadcaster Bill Odidi reports from Nairobi in this week's road trip
item.itunes:subtitle: Traditional benga music to Afro-fusion, plus Ayub Ogada plays the nyatiti
item.itunes:summary: Traditional benga music to Afro-fusion, plus legend Ayub Ogada plays the nyatiti (Kenyan harp); broadcaster Bill Odidi reports from Nairobi in this week's road trip
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Iran
item.description: February marked the 40th anniversary of the Iranian revolution, a time of fundamental change for Iran. Women had played a significant role in the revolution but in the aftermath and the ensuing years, they saw their rights and position in society restricted. In a special episode for International Women’s Day, this week’s Music Planet Road Trip comes via Persian singer and advocate for freedom of musical expression, Mahsa Vahdat. Get ready for soaring voices and century-old archive recordings from pre-revolution Tehran as Mahsa takes us on an inspirational musical journey with the women of Iran.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mahsa Vahdat takes us on an inspirational musical journey with the women of Iran
item.itunes:summary: February marked the 40th anniversary of the Iranian revolution, a time of fundamental change for Iran. Women had played a significant role in the revolution but in the aftermath and the ensuing years, they saw their rights and position in society restricted. In a special episode for International Women’s Day, this week’s Music Planet Road Trip comes via Persian singer and advocate for freedom of musical expression, Mahsa Vahdat. Get ready for soaring voices and century-old archive recordings from pre-revolution Tehran as Mahsa takes us on an inspirational musical journey with the women of Iran.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Denmark
item.description: A fierce fiddle jam in southern Denmark, tragic ballads about Nordic kings, and an old 1916 archive recording from the island of Fanø
item.itunes:subtitle: A fiddle jam in southern Denmark, Nordic kings, and a 1916 recording from Fanø island
item.itunes:summary: A fierce fiddle jam in southern Denmark, tragic ballads about Nordic kings, and an old 1916 archive recording from the island of Fanø
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Cyprus
item.description: From ancient choral motets to antagonistic rhyming couplets; Nicoletta Demetriou reports from an island at the crossroads between Asia, Africa and Europe
item.itunes:subtitle: From ancient choral motets to antagonistic rhyming couplets
item.itunes:summary: From ancient choral motets to antagonistic rhyming couplets; Nicoletta Demetriou reports from an island at the crossroads between Asia, Africa and Europe
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Estonia
item.description: Reporting from snowy Raugu, musician Mari Kalkun takes on a journey through 4000 years of Estonian music. This road trip comes complete with birdsong, bagpipes and great tunes.
item.itunes:subtitle: Reporting from snowy Raugu, Mari Kalkun takes us through 4000 years of Estonian music
item.itunes:summary: Reporting from snowy Raugu, musician Mari Kalkun takes on a journey through 4000 years of Estonian music. This road trip comes complete with birdsong, bagpipes and great tunes.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: South Texas
item.description: Betto Arcos is in South Texas this week exploring the rich musical tradition of the Conjunto ensemble - music reflecting Cuban, Mexican and German influences.
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos is in South Texas exploring music with Cuban, Mexican and German influences
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos is in South Texas this week exploring the rich musical tradition of the Conjunto ensemble - music reflecting Cuban, Mexican and German influences.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Barbados
item.description: From Calypso to Ska - DJ Alex Jordan explores the glorious music of Barbados, with music from Eddie Grant and interviews from Barbadian musicians Nikita Brown and the Mighty Gabby
item.itunes:subtitle: From Calypso to Ska - DJ Alex Jordan explores the glorious music of Barbados
item.itunes:summary: From Calypso to Ska - DJ Alex Jordan explores the glorious music of Barbados, with music from Eddie Grant and interviews from Barbadian musicians Nikita Brown and the Mighty Gabby
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Camino de Santiago
item.description: We're off on a musical pilgrimage along the Camino de Santiago or 'Way of Saint James' in northern Spain, with journalist Betto Arcos
item.itunes:subtitle: Betto Arcos with a musical pilgrimage along the Camino de Santiago in northern Spain
item.itunes:summary: We're off on a musical pilgrimage along the Camino de Santiago or 'Way of Saint James' in northern Spain, with journalist Betto Arcos
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Mexico - Narcocorrido music
item.description: Journalist Betto Arcos reports from Mexico in this guide through the controversial and often graphic song form of Narcocorrido (drug ballad) music
item.itunes:subtitle: Journalist Betto Arcos guides us through the controversial drug ballad music of Mexico
item.itunes:summary: Journalist Betto Arcos reports from Mexico in this guide through the controversial and often graphic song form of Narcocorrido (drug ballad) music
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: North Carolina
item.description: Old-style traditional musician Riley Baugus reports from the Blue Ridge Mountains with a banjo-fuelled, foot-stomping road trip through the Appalachians
item.itunes:subtitle: A foot-stomping, banjo-fuelled road trip through the Blue Ridge Mountains
item.itunes:summary: Old-style traditional musician Riley Baugus reports from the Blue Ridge Mountains with a banjo-fuelled, foot-stomping road trip through the Appalachians
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Mali
item.description: Producer Paul Chandler reports from Bamako, exploring the rich musical culture of Mali including interviews and music from Malian singer-songwriter Rokia Traore
item.itunes:subtitle: Producer Paul Chandler reports from Bamako, exploring the rich musical culture of Mali
item.itunes:summary: Producer Paul Chandler reports from Bamako, exploring the rich musical culture of Mali including interviews and music from Malian singer-songwriter Rokia Traore
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Xinjiang (China)
item.description: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian reports on the music of the autonomous Xinjiang region, including recordings from the oasis town of Hotan to Xinjiang's first hip-hop band.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian reports from China on the music at the heart of the Silk Road
item.itunes:summary: Ethnomusicologist Mu Qian reports on the music of the autonomous Xinjiang region, including recordings from the oasis town of Hotan to Xinjiang's first hip-hop band.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Peru
item.description: Broadcaster Betto Arcos reports from Lima, including music from inside a traditional Peña bar, the amazing sounds of Afro-Peruvian music 'Música Criolla', Cumbia music and beyond.
item.itunes:subtitle: Broadcaster Betto Arcos is in one of Lima's Peña bars for this week's Peruvian Road Trip
item.itunes:summary: Broadcaster Betto Arcos reports from Lima, including music from inside a traditional Peña bar, the amazing sounds of Afro-Peruvian music 'Música Criolla', Cumbia music and beyond.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Canary Islands
item.description: This week, Lopa whizzes around Gran Canaria in a taxi and finds some beautiful island melodies, plus a surprise arrangement of Michael Jackson on tiny Canarian guitars.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lopa whizzes around Gran Canaria in a taxi and encounters a very recognisable tune
item.itunes:summary: This week, Lopa whizzes around Gran Canaria in a taxi and finds some beautiful island melodies, plus a surprise arrangement of Michael Jackson on tiny Canarian guitars.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Bulgaria
item.description:
Singer Eugenia Georgieva takes us on a Road Trip to Bulgaria to see how music was used to keep a sense of national identity in the face of centuries of repression, from Bulgarian traditional folk to the famous female choirs.
Listen to the world - Music Planet, Radio 3's new world music show presented by Lopa Kothari and Kathryn Tickell, brings us the best roots-based music from across the globe - with live sessions from the biggest international names and the freshest emerging talent; classic tracks and new release, and every week a bespoke Road Trip from a different corner of the globe, taking us to the heart of its music and culture. Plus special guest Mixtapes and gems from the BBC archives. Whether it's traditional Indian ragas, Malian funk, UK folk or Cuban jazz, you'll hear it on Music Planet.
item.itunes:subtitle: Eugenia Georgieva takes us on a Road Trip to Bulgaria to explore the history and sounds.
item.itunes:summary:
Singer Eugenia Georgieva takes us on a Road Trip to Bulgaria to see how music was used to keep a sense of national identity in the face of centuries of repression, from Bulgarian traditional folk to the famous female choirs.
Listen to the world - Music Planet, Radio 3's new world music show presented by Lopa Kothari and Kathryn Tickell, brings us the best roots-based music from across the globe - with live sessions from the biggest international names and the freshest emerging talent; classic tracks and new release, and every week a bespoke Road Trip from a different corner of the globe, taking us to the heart of its music and culture. Plus special guest Mixtapes and gems from the BBC archives. Whether it's traditional Indian ragas, Malian funk, UK folk or Cuban jazz, you'll hear it on Music Planet.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Canada
item.description:
CBC's Wendy Bergfeldt takes us on a Road Trip to Cape Breton Island in Eastern Canada.
Listen to the world - Music Planet, Radio 3's new world music show presented by Lopa Kothari and Kathryn Tickell, brings us the best roots-based music from across the globe - with live sessions from the biggest international names and the freshest emerging talent; classic tracks and new releases, and every week a bespoke Road Trip from a different corner of the globe, taking us to the heart of its music and culture. Plus special guest Mixtapes and gems from the BBC archives. Whether it's traditional Indian ragas, Malian funk, UK folk or Cuban jazz, you'll hear it on Music Planet.
item.itunes:subtitle: Road Trip to Cape Breton Island in Eastern Canada, hosted by the CBC's Wendy Bergfeldt.
item.itunes:summary:
CBC's Wendy Bergfeldt takes us on a Road Trip to Cape Breton Island in Eastern Canada.
Listen to the world - Music Planet, Radio 3's new world music show presented by Lopa Kothari and Kathryn Tickell, brings us the best roots-based music from across the globe - with live sessions from the biggest international names and the freshest emerging talent; classic tracks and new releases, and every week a bespoke Road Trip from a different corner of the globe, taking us to the heart of its music and culture. Plus special guest Mixtapes and gems from the BBC archives. Whether it's traditional Indian ragas, Malian funk, UK folk or Cuban jazz, you'll hear it on Music Planet.

item.title: Turkey
item.description: Istanbul-born singer Cigdem Aslan guides us through the Alevi music of Turkey
item.itunes:subtitle: Istanbul-born singer Cigdem Aslan guides us through the Alevi music of Turkey

item.title: Paraguay
item.description: Betto Arcos takes on a virtual musical journey to Paraguay, in which we encounter vintage Paraguayan harp recordings of Félix Pérez Cardozo, the virtuosic electric bass of Paula Rodriguez and The Recycled Orchestra of Cateura.
item.itunes:subtitle: Paraguayan harp, virtuosic electric bass and The Recycled Orchestra of Cateura
item.itunes:summary: Betto Arcos takes on a virtual musical journey to Paraguay, in which we encounter vintage Paraguayan harp recordings of Félix Pérez Cardozo, the virtuosic electric bass of Paula Rodriguez and The Recycled Orchestra of Cateura.

item.title: Greenland
item.description: Join us for a musical journey through Greenland – taking in Inuit singing, drunken sailor shanties and the accidental discovery of the Hawaiian guitar.
item.itunes:subtitle: From Inuit singing to the accidental discovery of the Hawaiian guitar.
item.itunes:summary: Join us for a musical journey through Greenland – taking in Inuit singing, drunken sailor shanties and the accidental discovery of the Hawaiian guitar.

item.description: Artist manager Allie Silver reports from the Argentine capital Buenos Aires
item.itunes:subtitle: Artist manager Allie Silver reports from the Argentine capital Buenos Aires

item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: UK (British Asian)
item.description: Broadcaster Ashanti Omkar from the BBC Asian Network takes us on a Road Trip around the UK to explore British Asian music

item.title: Madagascar
item.description: Tsapiky, Salegy and the Valiha - Odilon Ranaivoson with a Road Trip to Madagascar
item.itunes:subtitle: Tsapiky, Salegy and the Valiha - Odilon Ranaivoson with a Road Trip to Madagascar

item.title: Portugal
item.description: Our Road Trip takes us to Festival Med in the South of Portugal where singer Sara Tavares was performing in June - her recommendations include some of the best in fado - from the historic recordings of Amalia Rodrigues to the contemporary sounds of Carminho - as well as local hip-hop artist Carlao who samples the funana bands of his parents' homeland of Cape Verde, an ancestry shared by Tavares herself.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sara Tavares takes us to Portugal in this week's Road Trip.
item.itunes:summary: Our Road Trip takes us to Festival Med in the South of Portugal where singer Sara Tavares was performing in June - her recommendations include some of the best in fado - from the historic recordings of Amalia Rodrigues to the contemporary sounds of Carminho - as well as local hip-hop artist Carlao who samples the funana bands of his parents' homeland of Cape Verde, an ancestry shared by Tavares herself.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Albania
item.description: Artist and music promoter Edit Pula takes us on a road trip through Albania's rich musical heritage
item.itunes:subtitle: Artist and music promoter Edit Pula takes us on a road trip to Albania

item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Jamaica
item.description: DJ and broadcaster Alex Jordan reports from Kingston, Jamaica for this week's Road Trip with music ranging from classic ska and rocksteady to contemporary dancehall.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ and broadcaster Alex Jordan reports from Kingston, Jamaica for this week's Road Trip.
item.itunes:summary: DJ and broadcaster Alex Jordan reports from Kingston, Jamaica for this week's Road Trip with music ranging from classic ska and rocksteady to contemporary dancehall.

item.title: Spain
item.description: This week's Road Trip takes us to Spain in the company of Max Moya, a percussion player formerly with the band Ojos de Brujo.
item.itunes:subtitle: Max Moya takes us on a road trip to Spain
item.itunes:summary: This week's Road Trip takes us to Spain in the company of Max Moya, a percussion player formerly with the band Ojos de Brujo.

item.title: Palestine
item.description: British-Palestinian singer Reem Kelani explores the traditional music of Palestine from before and after 1948, including 1920s singer Thourayya Kaddoura and a field recording made at the Ein al-Hilweh refugee camp in Lebanon.
item.itunes:subtitle: British-Palestinian singer Reem Kelani explores the traditional music of Palestine.
item.itunes:summary: British-Palestinian singer Reem Kelani explores the traditional music of Palestine from before and after 1948, including 1920s singer Thourayya Kaddoura and a field recording made at the Ein al-Hilweh refugee camp in Lebanon.

item.description: Amanda Kauranne takes us on a road trip to Finland.

item.title: Ghana
item.description: Rita Ray takes us on a journey through the music of Ghana

item.title: Russia
item.description: As excitement mounts for the 2018 World Cup in Russia, for this week's Road Trip Nataliya Myazina explores the rich culture of Russian folk and roots music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nataliya Myazina explores the rich culture of Russian folk and roots music.

item.title: Israel
item.description: This May marks 70 years since the declaration of the State of Israel, so for this week's Road Trip, the composer and oud player Yair Dalal talks to us from his home town, the ancient port city of Jaffa, about the rich and complex musical heritage of the communities within Israel.
item.itunes:subtitle: Yair Dalal on the rich and complex musical heritage of the communities within Israel.

item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Japan
item.description: We take a Roadtrip to Tokyo in the company of DJ and journalist Peter Barakan - he'll be giving us a flavour of where traditional Japanese roots music meets the alternative fringe across Japan.
item.itunes:subtitle: DJ and journalist Peter Barakan takes us on a Road Trip to Japan.

item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Rio de Janeiro
item.description: Music journalist and author Silvio Essinger reports from Rio de Janeiro.
item.itunes:subtitle: Music journalist and author Silvio Essinger reports from Rio de Janeiro.

item.title: Norway
item.description: Arne Berg is in Tromso in northern Norway for this week's Road Trip, reflecting both the country's mainstream roots-based music, and the songs of the Sami people.
item.itunes:subtitle: Arne Berg is in Tromso in northern Norway for this week's Road Trip.

item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: Zimbabwe
item.description: In this episode, as Zimbabwe emerges from its years under Robert Mugabe and Zimbabwe's exiled musicians start returning to their homeland, the singer and traditional mbira player Hope Masike introduces tracks that reflect Zimbabwe's rich heritage – and its lively present.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mbira player Hope Masike introduces tracks that reflect Zimbabwe's rich heritage.
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, as Zimbabwe emerges from its years under Robert Mugabe and Zimbabwe's exiled musicians start returning to their homeland, the singer and traditional mbira player Hope Masike introduces tracks that reflect Zimbabwe's rich heritage – and its lively present.
item.itunes:author: BBC Radio 3

item.title: All aboard for a Music Planet Road Trip
item.description: The team behind World on 3 are excited to introduce a new world music podcast, Music Planet: Road Trip. In each episode, a local expert transports us to a different part of the world, taking us in to the heart of its culture via its music. There’s no passport required; just headphones. Join us for a new episode every week.
item.itunes:subtitle: The team behind World on 3 are excited to introduce a new world music podcast...

Join us for a new episode every week.
